name: Lost for Words! 9 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Just wanna be your Teddy Bear 
Put a ______ around my neck and lead me anywhere 
Oh let me be (oh let him be) 
Your teddy bear"
What did Elvis ask to be put around his neck?
questions.explanation:
chain.

	Elvis Presley hit the charts with "(Let Me Be Your) Teddy Bear" in 1957. This single, written by Kal Mann and Bernie Lowe, a US chart topper was a UK #3 hit.

questions.text:
"Such a feeling's coming over me 
There is wonder in most every thing I see 
Not a cloud in the sky, got the ______ in my eyes 
And I won't be surprised if it's a dream"
Which word is missing from this Carpenters lyric?
questions.explanation:
sun.

	Richard and Karen Carpenter were on the "Top Of The World" with this single in 1973. A US #1 it peaked at #5 in the UK.

questions.text:
"And the operator says "40 cents more for the next ______ minutes" 
Please Mrs. Avery, I just gotta talk to her 
I'll only keep her a while 
Please Mrs Avery, I just wanna tell her goodbye"
Just how many minutes will 40 cents buy?
questions.explanation:
three.

	These lyrics come from "Sylvia's Mother", a 1972 hit for Dr. Hook and The Medicine Show.

questions.text:
Diana Ross sang these lyrics, but which word is missing?
"I'm in the middle of a ______ reaction 
You give me all the after midnight action 
I wanna get you where I can let you make all that love to me 
I'm on a journey for the inspiration"
questions.explanation:
chain.

	"Chain Reaction" was a 1986 hit for Diana Ross. This UK chart topper was written by Barry, Robin and Maurice Gibb.

questions.text:
"When we danced I held her tight 
Then I walked her home that night 
And all the stars were shining bright 
And then I ______ her"
So what did he do to her?
questions.explanation:
kissed.

	The Beach Boys hit the charts with "Then I Kissed Her" in 1967. This track features on the album "Summer Days".

questions.text:
"Easy lover 
She'll get a hold on you believe it 
Like no other 
Before you know it you'll be on your knees 
She's an easy lover 
She'll take your ______ but you won't feel it"
What goes missing in this lyric?
questions.explanation:
heart.

	"Easy Lover" was a hit for Phil Bailey and Phil Collins. A UK chart topper in 1984, the single peaked a #2 in the US. This track featured on the album "Chinese Wall".

questions.text:
"Cheer up sleepy ______, oh what can it mean
To a daydream believer and a homecoming queen?"
Which female's name fills the blank?
questions.explanation:
Jean.

	The Monkees hit the charts with "Daydream Believer" in 1967. This track, written by John C. Stewart, was a chart topper in both the US and UK.

questions.text:
"All the sweet, ______ icing flowing down 
Someone left the cake out in the rain 
I don't think that I can take it 
'cause it took so long to bake it 
And I'll never have that recipe again"
What was the colour of the icing on this soggy cake?
questions.explanation:
green.

	These strange lyrics come from "MacArthur Park", a 1968 hit for actor Richard Harris.

questions.text:
Can you complete this well known lyric?
"No, I can't forget this evening 
Or your ______ as you were leaving 
But I guess that's just the way the story goes 
You always smile but in your eyes your sorrow shows 
Yes, it shows"
questions.explanation:
face.

	"Without You" was a 1972 UK hit for Harry Nilsson. The single topped the charts on both sides of the Atlantic.

questions.text:
"Hold me, love me, hold me, love me
I ain't got nothing but love, babe
______ days a week"
Just how many days are there in this week?
questions.explanation:
Eight.

	These lyrics come from the Beatles track "Eight Days A Week". The song was written by John Lennon and McCartney.
